subject: Re: ANT Can't find Tools.jar
msgSnippet: I think that your problem is that you have installed a JRE on your machine and this is what is referenced in your windows
messageBody:
I think that your problem is that you have installed a JRE on your
machine and this is what is referenced in your windows
registry.(HKEY_CURRENT_USERS->Software->Javasoft->Java Runtime
Environment) this is where the jre1.5.0_06\lib is found.
As you point out tools.jar is not part of this jre.
You can try
option 1)adding the tools.jar file to the jre1.5.0_06\lib folder
option 2)uninstalling the JRE and installing a JDK(JDK has the tool.jar)
option 3) changing the entry in the registry




--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "whitworthjanet" <janet.e.whitworth@...>
wrote:
>
> Thanks for your response. The problem is that it should NOT be
> looking in program files. I have a j2sdk1.4.2_06 directory on my
> root C: drive and that is what I am referencing in my JAVA_HOME. I
> even went to what should be an unnecessart step to add the tools.jar
> for this directory to my CLASSPATH property. I am not using 1.5 yet
> since it has not been approved by the organization that I work for.
